p: Sennoside A drug was used as a reductant to the reduction of Ag + ions for the fabrication of AgNPs. In a typical experiment, sennoside A (1.4 × 10 −4 mol/L) was added drop-wise in a conical flask containing 5 ml aqueous solution of AgNO 3 (0.01 mol/L; total volume = 40 ml) under constant stirring with a help of a magnetic stirrer at 1500 rpm for 30 min. The appearance of yellow, orange to dark brown colors was indicated the reduction of Ag + ions into metallic silver (Ag 0). The resulting brown red color was centrifuged for 30 min with 15 000 rpm at 298 K. The obtained solid AgNPs were dried at 353 K and stored in dark condition at room temperature. In the next experiment, same sennoside A solution was added in a mixture of AgNO 3 and CTAB (0.073 g, 0.02 mmol) to determine the effect of CTAB on the Ag/sennoside A. Optical images of reaction mixture containing sennoside A, Ag + and CTAB are given in Scheme 2 at different time intervals.
